metadata.title: CVE-2018-18225 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
In Wireshark 2.6.0 to 2.6.3, the CoAP dissector could crash. This wasaddressed in epan/dissectors/packet-coap.c by ensuring that the piv lengthis correctly computed.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-18225` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwireshark-data - 2.6.4-2~ubuntu18.04.0
libwireshark11 - 2.6.4-2~ubuntu18.04.0
libwiretap8 - 2.6.4-2~ubuntu18.04.0
libwscodecs2 - 2.6.4-2~ubuntu18.04.0
libwsutil9 - 2.6.4-2~ubuntu18.04.0
tshark - 2.6.4-2~ubuntu18.04.0
wireshark - 2.6.4-2~ubuntu18.04.0
wireshark-common - 2.6.4-2~ubuntu18.04.0
wireshark-gtk - 2.6.4-2~ubuntu18.04.0
wireshark-qt - 2.6.4-2~ubuntu18.04.0
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wireshark package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.6.4-2~ubuntu18.04.0').
